column5: funny, Brian had to remind me to walk in our foot prints on the way back in, a minor brain fart  but yeah, we had ropes,  picks, floater suits spuds and know how to test the ice  the thing that scares me the most is when a guy, 2 kids and a dog sees us out there and just starts walking out in the general area we are with no regard to ice conditions or personal safety didn't happen today but has happened in the past

Funny how many pm,s I got today. All my answers were,sorry,I will not be the one that said go.  Know where your going,know your limits. 4 inches of black ice,Im walking comfortably. We stepped and chipped all our way out and abound.  I didnt post to say it was safe for all or any to go. I posted this report,as it the earliest we both had ever been out.  Terry and I have been around the block a few times. I trust his thinking,and Im sure he does mine.  Knowing now, by reading other boards,,the word is out.  Be safe,know yer limits.  Maybe I shouldnt of posted this at all. Some guy reading .OH THOSE GUYS ARE OUT,IT,S SAFE, goes through and I,ll feel like a  Try to spell my name right will ya.LOL

Glad to see you guys went out and had some fun.... Myself on the other hand will wait for the few cm's of snow coming tonight so I don't have to look down clear black ice  BRING ON THE ICE SEASON!  Be safe everyone.
Woohoo.  It came a little too soon, but may as well embrace it now
I'm still trying to figure out which is Brian.. which is Terry ! "Cant' live with'm.. can't shoot'm !"
I could probably go on a couple of ponds in town... But i'll wait! Nice to see the north is ready though!
well we only found one lake I would think most are not ready

Damit,knew I should of got the white one. Hahahaha, nuttin that a couple of old bedsheets can't fix...  Maybe you can borrow one from Ma Bell, nobody would think twice then, just normal goofing off instead of working..
My kids have been skating for 3 days now on our homemade rink in Kitchener...crazy.
Great stuff Brian….very jealous…can't believe you guys are on the ice b4 me!!!!!
looks like a fun day guys, I bet it sure felt good to be back on the ice again

Thats what happens when yer buds. Not that kind a BUD.LOL  LOL    I know another surface thats safe Roger.   Glad the kids are having fun.   Oh Im sure you will make up for it,and have me sullivating soon enough Simon. Tease.LOL    That it did Chris. Nice to see yer outing was nice as well..   After driving this morning to do some scouting,I did find a few lakes that were not safe yet.  Couch  Not happening anytime soon.    From a lake I was hoping to fish this morning.  Not happening.. 10 ft from shore. I heard cracking,and was off like a scared jack rabbit.    What I found? Where the snow fell,the winds blew,the lakes are not safe. I could see different stages of ice formation on all of them.  We were lucky enough to have the ice we did yesterday. Froze over for 8 days,and the temps were well below -10 all those nights.  Looking at the temps coming,I my just grab the float rod for bit.  We got a tease,and I,ll take it.  Before we all know it,we,ll be slaying lakers and whites and perch and thos pesky herring which we cant keep.  Be safe all.and enjoy yer winter wonderland,when it comes.
Glad to see (got the msg yesterday you 2 were out) that all and all it was just good to get out on the ice that was deemed safe at the time in the area.

WERE   ICEFISHING     I couldnt believe it when I checked a lake and there was 4 inches of good black ice.  We did run into a lake that seemed to have a major weed die off,cuz we couldnt find any and the water looked real murky. Visability was 4 ft in 15 fow. Not good for us,but we got out the earliest we have ever in all our years.  New Ice armour suit was perfect. What a difference from a bulky one piece suit. New HH under wear is primo warm.  New eskimo hub 2 man,well,it,s a one man to me,but it will do what I need it to do,and thats to keep me warm and out of the wind.          The screws anchors that come with the hub are so easy to turn in by hand and hold awesome.

you mean you were on the ice today  are you nuts   there it was said  yup lots of good black ice, but not lots of fish...it was great getting out  i was afraid we might have to drive to north bay to find god ice, glad we found it much closer
Where are the fish?

WERE   ICEFISHING     I couldnt believe it when I checked a lake and there was 4 inches of good black ice.  We did run into a lake that seemed to have a major weed die off,cuz we couldnt find any and the water looked real murky. Visability was 4 ft in 15 fow. New eskimo hub 2 man,well,it,s a one man to me,but it will do what I need it to do,and thats to keep me warm and out of the wind.          The screws anchors that come with the hub are so easy to turn in by hand and hold awesome.   I saw you out there,at least you didn't have to fight the crowds.Any bites?
Thats what I would like to know.
Sweet. Would have been nice to get out this weekend....chores and work instead.
http://i27.photobucket.com/albums/c177/Mrtbeee/DSCF4626.jpg
Where did you find the ice??? That's friggin awesome! I'm itchin' to get out
I see Terry packed light as usual!
I see Terry packed light as usual!  He was missing a few things Wayne,,but he managed.LOL
hey I didnt bring a hut or heater or underwater camera...thought I was doing good
That would explain yer frequient visits to mine.LMAO
never came in, too hot in there
Hey, I know that lake. Any luck?
Someone else mentioned they saw a red hut on the ice, maybe have to go for a drive tomorrow.  I know that place.
Someone else mentioned they saw a red hut on the ice, maybe have to go for a drive tomorrow.  I know that place. Saw that as well .lmao!!!
How far did you have to go? (Just wondering what area)
Someone else mentioned they saw a red hut on the ice, maybe have to go for a drive tomorrow.  I know that place.  Damit,knew I should of got the white one.
See this makes me happy that I pulled my ice gear out yesterday
Mines been ready since the end of March last season.lol.
Im sure it will be a busy place Sunday morning now. LMAO  Like I care. Just have fun and be safe.

Be safe are the key words here! Someone will push the limit for the sake of getting out there, someone will pay with their life. Happens every year! When we tested the ice here it was three guys, roped together, 50' apart flotation suits and a boat in tow. Tested the ice every 50' or so. Just remember the next step could be your last step. Perhaps I am over cautious but there is a very slim chance that you will ever read that Big Cliff went through the ice and drowned. I haven't lived this long by being stupid LOL.

So true...you`ll never find me on anything under 10"...just don`t know what the rush is.

so you must drive out with that much ice, I know people who think you are crazy 2ft of good ice or stay off, whats the rush..10 " crazy  but really no rush,  very safe ice if you know what you are doing we chipped 50 holes and drilled another 50..if you don't know what you're doing no thickness is safe

so you must drive out with that much ice, I know people who think you are crazy 2ft of good ice or stay off, whats the rush..10 " crazy  but really no rush,  very safe ice if you know what you are doing we chipped 50 holes and drilled another 50..if you don't know what you're doing no thickness is safe Terry you are so right and I know you are one of the smart ones. Unfortunatly there are those that seem to THINK they are smart and end up paying the price. (Just like no bank rober thinks they will ever be caught. The jails are full of them LOL.)  I know you and would follow you out almost anywhere (walking in your foot steps)!  Just glad to hear you had a good time and you were safe!
